An analyst collected samples of the prices (in Â£000s) of 25 one-bedroom flats in each

An estimate of the true significance level for this two-sided test, when the chosen 
level of significance is Î± = 0.1, can be computed using the R Monte Carlo simulation 
code provided below: 
```{r}
set.seed(123) # 
alpha = 0.1 
m=20 
n=20 
N=8000 
nrej=0 
for (i in 1:N) { # 
x=rnorm(m,mean=0,sd=1); y=rnorm(n,mean=0,sd=1) # 
ts=t.test(x, y, var.equal=TRUE)$stat # 
df = n+m-2 # 
if (abs(ts)>=qt(1-alpha/2, df)) # 
nrej=nrej+1 # 
} 
alpha_est=nrej/N # 
```

Note that the code provided above lacks best practice of including appropriate 
comments.
